content: My A1C has been consistently around 8.5 for the past 6 months. I'm 52, male, and have been on metformin for 3 years but it's not controlling my blood sugar well anymore. Doctor mentioned adding another medication. Anyone else had similar experience with combination therapy?
author: diabetes_warrior52

content: Been dealing with type 2 diabetes for 8 years. I'm a 47-year-old woman, HbA1c is 7.8. Currently on metformin and glipizide but still struggling with post-meal spikes. Looking for advice on diet modifications or maybe newer medications.
author: healthy_goals_47

content: Another frustrating diabetes appointment today. My numbers are still not where they should be despite medication. A1C at 8.1 ðŸ˜” Doctor wants to try a new treatment approach. Anyone tried GLP-1 agonists? #diabetes #t2d
author: @diabetic_journey

content: 55M here, diagnosed with T2D 4 years ago. Despite diet changes and exercise, my A1C is stuck at 7.9. On metformin 2000mg daily. Doctor suggested clinical trial participation. Has anyone here participated in diabetes research studies?
author: research_curious

content: 42F with gestational diabetes that became type 2 after pregnancy. Currently managing with lifestyle but A1C crept up to 7.6. Considering medication options. Would love to contribute to diabetes research if there are opportunities.
author: mom_with_diabetes
